loaders

Detailed Description

The group of methods of the WML, Wednus Module Loaders.

 Reserved namespace for c (control) specific variables.

W include

Initial value:

 function(subpath, name){
    this.load(subpath, name, 'include');
}
JS loader interface - user library loader.

It loads user JS library. It loads up one of multiple controls to the platform.

Parameters:
subpath relative path after platform installation path(W.path)
name name(s) of the library(s)
Note:
It supports batch processing
See also:
W.load

Definition at line 40 of file wml.js.

W include_css

Initial value:

 function(subpath, name){
    this.css(this.path + subpath + '/'+ name +'.css');
}
CSS loader interface.

This function loads a CSS resource existing under the platform root.

Parameters:
subpath path on top of W.path
name CSS filename
Warning:
It doesn't check any duplicated loadings.

Definition at line 53 of file wml.js.

W control

Initial value:

 function(name){
    this.load('control/'+ name, name, 'control');
}
JS loader interface - control(user module) loader.

This is the user module(control) loader. It loads up one of multiple controls to the platform.

Note:
it supports batch processing
Parameters:
name name(s) of the control(s)
See also:
W.load
Todo:
mutiple modules loading from a control folder
Todo:
remote loading version. W.control('XParser', 'http://wednus.com/WServer/XParser');

Definition at line 69 of file wml.js.

W module

Initial value:

 function(name){
    this.load('module/'+ name, name, 'module');
}
JS loader interface - system module loader.

This is the system module loader. As you can see from the example below, It can load multiple modules of the same library category and register the names to 'W.modules', the loaded module library. For user module(control) loading, please use 'W.control' method instead. 

 W.module('DOM', 'Element,elements');
This will load up the 'Element' and 'elements' modules of the 'DOM' library category on the platform. 
 W.module('wednus_wom,wednus_debug');
This will load up the 'wednus_wom' and 'wednus_debug' modules from the root 'include/' directory.
Note:
W.include and W.require functions are virtually similar in their function except for the way they handle an irretrievable resource. W.include and provide a warning if the resource cannot be retrieved and try to continue execution of the program if possible. W.require provide stop processing the page if it cannot retrieve the resource.
Parameters:
lib library name (or 'wednus_*' module name when 'mNames' is not passed)
mNames list of module names
See also:
W.modules, W.load

Definition at line 98 of file wml.js.

 function(name){

W app

Initial value:

 function(name, args){
    this.load('app/'+ name, name, 'app');
    this.event(window, 'onload', function(){W.a[name](args);});
}
JS loader interface - wednus application loader.

It loads user JS library. It loads up one of multiple controls to the platform.

Parameters:
subpath relative path after platform installation path(W.path)
name name(s) of the library(s)
Note:
It supports batch processing
See also:
W.load
